result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Burrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Benjamin J Burrill.  Prosecuting attorney Rose Marie Yanke in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Yanke gives the court her sentencing recommendation. The parties stipulate on the defendants prior convictions. Attorney Lloyd makes a statement to the court regarding sentencing. Defendant makes a statement regarding sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Benjamin J Burrill. 
Defendant is rejecting the global offer and would like to go to trial.
Attorney Lambert gives the global offer to the court.
Final pre-trial on June 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Benjamin J Burrill. 
Defendant does not wish to accept offer. Matters will be set for trial. Attorney Lambert states offer for record.
Defendant wishes to have more time to think about the offer. Court suggests matters be set for trial and other matters will be set for FPT.
Attorney Lambert suggests that all matter be set for FPT for victims' sake. Court agrees. All matters will be set for FPT on 6/15/22 at 2:00 p.m.
Final pre-trial on May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Attorney Peter C Lloyd c for Benjamin J Burrill appeared in court. 

Atty Lloyd requests a new final pretrial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial 03/15/22
treatment record
cover letter from Attorney Lloyd requesting adjournment
No contact w/victim or their residence.    Absolute sobriety.  Do not possess ANY firearms/weapons.  Report to a Norwood Health Center or one similar to it and take an assessment.
No contact w/victim or their residence.  Absolute sobriety. Do not possess ANY firearms/weapons. Report to a Norwood Health Center or one similar to it and take an assessment.

09:47 AM Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in court with attorney Peter C Lloyd.  Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in custody in the Wood County Jail.  Matthew Steven McElroy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin J Burrill appeared by video means with Attorney.
Attorney Lloyd makes an argument for the bond modification. 
Attorney McElroy makes an argument against a bond modification.
Attorney McElroy spoke with the victim witness coordinator and the victim in this case does not oppose a bond modification, however, the victim in another case is opposed and does not want the signature bond put in place.
Attorney McElroy gives the court a condition he would like to add if the court grants the modification. 
Court grants and modifies the bond.
Bail/bond hearing on January 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.

01:36 PM Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in court with attorney Peter C Lloyd.  Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in custody.  Matthew Steven McElroy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin J Burrill appeared by video means with Attorney. 
Court addresses the motion hearing from yesterday and the agreement that we made. Courts found out that Norwood will not accept him until he is released from jail for the assessment. 
Court denies the bond modification for a signature bond. 
Attorney Lloyd requests a lower cash bond. 
Court informs them that a bond modification can't be done yet because the victim needs notifications of those hearings. 
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

11:03 AM Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in court with attorney Peter C Lloyd.  Matthew Steven McElroy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court goes over the reason for this motion hearing. 
Attorney Lloyd makes a statement for the bond modification.
Court will modify the bond to a signature bond when there is confirmation of him being able to go to Norwood for treatment. 
Once this modification happens the defendant can go there and needs to report to the jail afterwards and we can review bond again. 
The jail can transport or a family member can if Officer Wunrow agrees w/ it. 
Bond is continued.

11:03 AM Defendant Benjamin J Burrill in court with attorney Peter C Lloyd.  Matthew Steven McElroy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives the preliminary hearing. Not guilty pleas are entered. Bond is continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bond Reduction
No contact with victim or their residence. Absolute sobriety. Possess no firearms. $3000
